"This is for Boris from me, for his outfit." 
Anna Mikhdylovna was already embracing her and weeping. The countess wept too. They wept because they were friends, and because 
they were kindhearted, and because t they friends from childhood had to think about such a base thing as money, and because their youth was over. . . . But those tears were pleas- ant to them both.
